<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">[Time Sense](/Spells.aspx?ID=1193)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 183</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Mystery**
[Time](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=9)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Single Action" /></row>
<row>[verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

When you Cast the Spell, you gain a perfect sense of time. You can learn exactly what time it is, down to the second. You can instead choose to gain a perfect sense of the calendar if you have knowledge in that area—if you're trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10), you can learn exactly how long it is until sunrise and how many days until the next solstice. If you're trained in [Astronomy Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8), you can learn precisely when any known predictable astronomical conjunction will begin and end, and so on.

 You can gain a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check you take on the same turn you cast _time sense_ that requires extremely precise timing. If you choose to gain this bonus, you can't gain it again for 1 hour.
name: Time Sense
